DataElement.preferredName: Neuro-QOL Item Bank v2.0 Adult Mental Health Cognitive Function NQCOG26r1 How Much Difficulty Currently Have Planning Activity Several Days in Advance Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much difficulty they currently have planning an activity several days in advance (e.g., a meal, trip, or visit to friends), using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain Neuro QoL Cognitive Function Subdomain How Much Current Difficulty Planning Activity Several Days in Advance Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health._The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.:_A question about how much difficulty an individual currently has or had planning an activity several days in advance._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability

ObjectClass.preferredName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain Neuro QoL Cognitive Function Subdomain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health.:The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.

Concepts.longName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain
Concepts.definition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health.
The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.

Property.preferredName: How Much Current Difficulty Planning Activity Several Days in Advance Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about how much difficulty an individual currently has or had planning an activity several days in advance._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about how much difficulty an individual currently has or had planning an activity several days in advance.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition._An ordered reference standard used with the Neuro-QoL item bank that describes a reverse range of subjective scores for representing how much an individual experiences something from 5: None, to 2: A lot and including 1: Cannot do.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual cannot do something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description:
How much DIFFICULTY do you currently have planning an activity several days in advance (e.g., a meal, trip, or visit to
friends)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
